H0.text: Jet stream is what many scientists think birds use to locate the same destination each year during migration.

H1.text: Weather patterns are what many scientists believe birds use to locate the same destination each year when they migrate.

H2.text: Magnetic patterns of Earth are what many scientists think birds use to find the same location each year when they migrate.

H3.text: Electrical discharges are believed by many scientists to help birds locate the same destination each year when they migrate.

A4.text: Navigation has been shown to be based on a combination of other abilities including the ability to detect magnetic fields (magnetoreception)

A5.text: There is a neural connection between the eye and 'Cluster N', the part of the forebrain that is active during migrational orientation, suggesting that birds may actually be able to see the magnetic field of the Earth
